The Elder Who Gave Rice Porridge
The One with Golden Skin, the Buddha,
with thirty-two excellent signs,
after going forth from the Pāvāla family,
was in the lead of the Community of monks.

original: Mahaccā kaṁsapātiyā,🔽vaḍḍhetvā pāyasaṁ ahaṁ;🔽Āhutiṁ yiṭṭhukāmo so,
analyzed: mahaccā kasapātiyā  vaḍḍhetvā pāyasam aha  āhutim yiṭṭhu kāmaḥ saḥ
translated: I had a large bronze bowl🔽in which I had prepared rice porridge.🔽Desiring to make an offering,

original: upanesiṁ baliṁ ahaṁ.🔽Bhagavā tamhi samaye,🔽lokajeṭṭho narāsabho;
analyzed: upanesim balim aha  bhagavā tamhi samaye  loka jeṭṭhaḥ narāsabhaḥ
translated: I brought it as an offering.🔽At that time,🔽the Buddha, the chief of the world, the best of men,
was standing on the path,
in the sky, in the windless atmosphere.
Seeing that wonder,
that marvel that made the hairs stand up,
I put down the bronze bowl
and looked on, paying homage.
You are the god who knows all,
together with the gods and humans.
Out of compassion,
accept it, Great Sage.
The Buddha, the one who knows all, the leader of the world,🔽accepted it,
knowing my intention,
the Teacher, the Great Sage in the world.
For ninety-one eons,
the gift I gave then,
I do not remember any bad destination,
this is the fruit of the rice porridge.
For twenty-one eons,
was a Buddha named Khattiya;
He was endowed with the seven treasures,
a powerful Universal Monarch.
